circumstances: During the takeoff roll at Salt Lake City Airport, the crew completed the rotation too early. The aircraft stalled then crashed in flames near the runway. The aircraft was destroyed and both pilots were killed.
probable_cause:
Premature liftoff on part of the flying crew. The following factors were considered as contributing:
- The pilot-in-command failed to obtain flying speed,
- Physical impairment, 
- Crew fatigue, 
- Improperly loaded aircraft-weight and/or CofG, 
- Icing conditions including sleet and freezing rain, 
- Obstructions to vision.
